comments.body:
Either a gamerule to disable/enable the feature (can be enabled by default) or a gamerule to limit the amount of pearls that can load chunks (default could be infinite).

This new change does make me worry about potential lag as it's very easy to setup.
Can you add new behaviors to mobs like cows pigs or sheep and a new dimension?
VERTICAL SLABS!

Should add a something similar to tinker's construct, building your own forge and using molten metals to create tools and utils is to fun, if not that the deeper and darker or twilight forest would be top tier

In order to keep the importance of the turtle egg, you should only be able to get one or a few scutes per turtle after they grow up. This gives more functions for the brush while keeping the scute method consistent.

Is java better or bedrock
Bedrock is a boring name we should have bedrock and command block edition because there both unbreakable in java and bedrock
Agree we are making it when GTA VI comes out fall 2025

Flowering plants do not bear fruit.
Different stages should be added, replacing each other.
Is my idea

Ornamental Cherry trees (the kind the new cherry trees are based on) don't have that kind of cherry fruit. Their fruits mostly seed and what little flesh there is is extremely sour. Some parts of sakura trees are even poisonous, and the devs definitely don't want to make people think they can go around eating things off poisonous plants.
Not actually necessary, and this kind of tree doesn't actually produce palatable fruits.
I think that it could also stay in creative mode but while remaining in the operator utilities tab in the creative inventory menu.

1. Why is this in the "Java snapshots" category? This probably should be in the "Blocks, tools, & items" category.

2. This can be done 2 ways:
a) Use a resource pack to make item frames invisible. (simple, only works from your side, though)
b) Use the "armor statues" armor stand editing datapack. It allows you to use invisible armor stands for the same purpose.

3. (for creative mode) You could use display entities for the same purposes as Armor stands.

4. It is still a great idea, and something I would like to see added.
No, unbalanced/too OP.
zinminthant

The idea of an elytra is that you sacrifice the most vital piece of armor to increase mobility and speed. I don’t know if you’ve ever tried 100% maxed armor, but it is nearly impossible to die. You can take lava baths for over a minute! Elytra’s and chest plates can’t work together.
ok lets do it
Okay, send the developers an optimization code that will at least make the FPS playable.
GET A PC

Two points:

1. To my knowledge, Java coding is not supported by those consoles... That is why Bedrock edition exists. Parity updates would serve this purpose better...

2. Why? you have bedrock edition on consoles, if you want to play the PC exclusive version, get a PC. (you could use a Xbox controller connected to a PC...)

3. I'm not certain it would be worth it, as a version of Minecraft is already on those consoles. I'm pretty sure the only reason Bedrock is even on PC is for the sole purpose of cross-platform-play.
i do got a pc my boi
Please revert back the reporting system. The system can get abused easily and games like Roblox can show how disastrous it can be and blocking/muting is a better alternative way

Please allow some way for servers to disable the chat reporting feature, or at least some categories (particularly looking at swearing and drugs and alcohol, though I have concerns with others, too)

Optimally I feel like you should send chat reports to the server admins to determine if they warrant being sent to mojang/microsoft, though if you, for one reason or another, decide you want to handle the potentially massive volume of reports entirely by yourself, you should allow servers to disable this. Not all servers should have to be forced to act as though there are constantly small children around, especially not small, private whitelisted ones.
Please, be specific with the chat reporting! We still know very little about how long punishments will last, and whether or not they will be toggleable.
Please add the ability to toggle chat reporting on servers. Thanks

Please don't go forward with this reporting system. It is not your responsibility to moderate the chat of a server that is not being operated by you. We can already block players, that's enough.

The amount of communication between you and the players regarding this is disgusting.
Allay duplication should be reverted to 2.5 minutes
If ‘moderator’ means server admins, then I’m fine. Though, being completely banned from online play is kinda ridiculous and should just be banned from the server(s) in with the chat was sent.

I think if it was changed to a all-round reporting system(not just chat) that is controlled by the server’s admin, and does not harm the player’s ability to join other servers, it would be much better
I do not like this chat reporting feature because it could easily be abused. Do not implement it. Or at the very least make it toggleable on a server by server basis.
It's sad to see you ignoring the concerns and demands people have with / for such a reporting system. I do encourage everyone to spread word about mods that disarm the reporting system server side.
Yeah so this reporting system thing is actually a failure and adding it to the game is legitamitely a terrible awful idea.

What about the issue where the deep dark biome is not generating outside of the ancient cities? I upgraded my 1.18 world to 1.19, went 1000 blocks in the nether and came out in the overworld where I had never explored and no deep dark anywhere. I copied the world and went into spectator mode and I don't find deep dark anywhere. Chunkbase shows no instances of deep dark.

The chat reporting feature is a huge misstep that can be easily abused. If this were simply for Realms or Mojang-owned servers, that would be one thing. But we're talking about privately owned, privately funded servers that have their own mechanisms of moderation in place. This is not okay and it will cause massive problems in the community.

Privately-funded and owned servers keep Minecraft as a whole alive. The resurgence of SMPs in 2019 and beyond helped to save Minecraft from a steep decline. This is a step in the wrong direction and needs to be undone and never, ever explored again. If these comments here don't convince you, look at the hundreds of comments on other platforms. All of these comments are from people who care about this game and who keep the community strong through interacting in it.
The new reporting system is an awful idea and should be reverted back ASAP.
Scrap chat reporting.  Why do you even ask for feedback when you just ignore it?

The introduction of chat reporting and imposition of Microsoft Will against privately owned and Operated Servers must Cease Immediately. 

The games original creator, with immense Foresight, understood that operating hundreds of thousands of servers in this game would be neither cost effective nor practical. In a game focused on Player creation and player ownership it was implicitly understood that it does not and should not fall to Mojang or by extension now Microsoft to policy third party servers. 

this game has operated without such oversight without issue for nearly 14 years. 
Expect Concentrated, Concerted, and Repeated efforts from the Java Community to disable this function by any and all means at hand.
Please completely remove the report feature for private server or set an on off options, the fact that feedbacks has to be verified says that you guys can just delete unwanted feedbacks

Please remove the reporting system. We players can handle the banning on our own servers.
I don't see the reason why we need a reporting system when we have the /ban command to ban players who break the rules.

what the hell, are you seriously gonna completely ignore our feedback?

pretty much everyone was against the reporting feature on the 22w24a feedback page, and you lot decided to keep going?

that really isn't how feedback works.
Can you fix cave biomes based on this planetminecraft datapack called better cave gen as the cave biome layout is boring

Please for the love of god make the report feature an opt-in or some sort of option, because if i've read the reports about bedrock correctly and how that is turning out, this is not going to be good.

As someone who's been playing since beta 1.4, the chat reporting leaves me deeply concerned about the future of Minecraft. If this only applies to Realms, that would be one thing. But why in the world so you take it upon yourself to moderate private servers and override their own rules? I play on a private server with only people I know from college, but now I have to worry about being permanently banned from all online play because I might be using profanity or talking about alcohol with other adults.

This entire "feature" needs to either be scrapped or undergo a huge rework. It is not your place to moderate private servers unless you're going to start reimbursing server owners for their costs.

The chat reporting system is a disaster waiting to happen and a massive overreach. Java server hosts have had their own tools to do this for years. It's unnessesary and ignores the fact that not every group of people has the same set of values. Trust server hosts to deal with these things ourselves like we always have. Enforcing one standard of rules, on *private servers* no less, is a massive breach of basic privacy. Disgusting.

Please revert this chat reporting feature and listen to the community's feedback. Stop making the wild update the most hated update ever. Fireflies got scrapped because of terrible reasons, and now this?

There's going to be tons of permanent false bans in Java, just like in Bedrock, with no appeal process. Swearing and phrases like "I'll kill you" or "I'll blow you up" is very common in this game. Without proper context there will be tons of false bans, caused by toxic players targeting people they don't like. Roblox is infamous for these kinds of false bans.

There are also many adults playing Minecraft, and they should be allowed to swear and talk adult stuff in their private servers and realms.

Stop wasting Mojang's resources on detrimental things like moderating chats, or making vids about "near-extinct animal/plant awareness", and please just focus on making a fun fantasy game. Minecraft is slowly getting suffocated by terrible decisions, and competitors like Hytale will eventually win at this rate.

I'm against the report system, its not practical and can be abuse. Let us, server owners handle that by our own.

 

Is there any point of this feedback section?

Like do they even read?

The report feature is good on paper, keeping people safe from bad actors. But what if those bad actors use it to mass report innocent people and get them banned permanently? For Realms, it'd be fine, since you guys own that, but privately owned servers seems like a no-no, they have been proven to be capable of moderating themselves.

PLEASE allow 3rd party servers to opt out of the ban-list.  It makes sense to ban people from Microsoft's servers e.g. realms, but many if not most 3rd party servers maintain their own whitelists and blacklists and don't want those edited or added to by Microsoft/Mojang.  Bad actors on a server can organize to mass-report a genuinely good user, or moderator, etc.  Let 3rd party servers manage their own ban lists if they prefer.

Remove the chat reporting system it is gonna destroy private servers and people who just wanna play minecraft it is not solving anything let the servers ban and mute people on their own it's not your job. This is what almost everyone is saying about this feature and I agree with them mojang shouldn't be doing this it affects everyone I've already seen people saying they will bot spam people with reports to get them banned remove this feature and you will at least fix the damage you have caused already to the community.

- ZeDarkOne

I think that Amethyst shards in allays duplication should be replaced with music disk fragments, because these will make more player want to go to ancient cities and make this function difficult enough, because it's too easy now.

This extra territorial jurisdiction is horrible, what happens in 1 server should not effect the other. Minecraft Multiplayer is decentralised by nature, it should be up to the server admins to ban users if they break the rules, Microsoft should not be involved.  This is a horrible import from the bedrock which it should not even exist there it will be easy to fake reports or for reports to be misinterpreted, different servers have different rules, accounts can be hacked, there is no visible way to file an appeal that is easy to see, it is a general violation of freedom, people may just act certain ways on certain servers. It is also a violation of privacy especially if someone does not want Microsoft seeing the messages of the server.

Permanent bans aren't a very good idea imo; should only be applicable if the behavior was really bad. if it was just swearing or some other minor offense, that would be overkill, and really Mojang shouldn't need to handle it at all. Plus it could easily be abused assuming there's no way for Mojang to get context or to filter clearly false reports, like if someone was swearing on a server that allows it or even filters it by default.

 

Maybe you guys could add parental controls instead?

It's not hard to see what 99% of the Java Minecraft community wants. Please think before you destroy such an amazing long lasting community.

It is in no way your right to swoop in and moderate 3rd party private servers that have been moderating themselves for over a decade.

I think having an **opt-in** system where banned Minecraft players are unable to join would be a nice feature for some small servers, but it HAS TO BE dictated by the administrator(s) of the server in question. Realms is fine, that's your space. Interfering with the rule sets as dictated by these 3rd party servers' admins is simply unacceptable.

Please revert back the reporting system.

I've had a minecraft server for 5 years. With this new reporting system we will initiate the end of the server and no longer update to 1.19.1. This update is uncovered. The server owner alone should decide who gets banned and who doesn't. I didn't know that Mojang pays the server costs and can decide who is allowed to play on the server and who is not!
This system will bring chaos to all servers. Players who don't like trolls or server employees will report staffler for no reason. We don't want to keep supporting the game with the fear of being banned for no reason. We say NO to the system.
this reporting system is just not good, but rather awful to be honest... no one in the community likes this. do not go forward with this, the downfall of minecraft is about to start.

The global ban system is a terrible idea and will be abused more than it will do good. You might say that it can not be abused since you have people reading the reports but as with all games with similar systems some people will definitely fall through the cracks and be banned on false grounds. As many have requested before me: please let server/realm owners toggle this feature off in order to protect the players. Thank you.

The global ban system is really rising a concern, what about servers that explicitly allow something that other servers didn't allow (like swearing)!? While it may come out from a good intention, each server should at least have the option to decide whether they will let global ban players to join.

There are also already some third parties groups such mcban doing the same thing, so I really see no reason for Mojang to do that by themselves.
revert or atleast add an option to remove the chat report feture

Ban system is just a catastrophe.
1. System can be abused, especially on small servers.
2. Sometimes you can say something wrong, it's ok, but ban for that isn't cool. Minecraft isn't a cheap game, but banned accounts are nothing because banned players will just play cracked game.
3. What if you just want to play with friends? On server with no rules?
Minecraft isn't a shooter where you can be banned for cheats. With official ban system it will be impossible to play normally because you know ghat all you messages can be sent to mojang.
Delete or allow servers to turn off reporting system.

Please revert the reporting system. It's really easy to get abused with steamers asking to spam report people and youtubers organizing raids. It'd also be very easy to make spam report cheats therefore banning anyone and everyone!
Get rid of censorship

Let's talk about how much of a terrible idea this is, and how this is going to be the absolute death of Minecraft at this rate.

 

Seriously, revert this decision.

Please allow server admins to disable the reporting feature. You are going to get loads of reports and eventually turn to an automatic system for moderation. This is going to lead to people abusing the system to just get rid of people they don't like. Servers will also have varying levels of rules. Unless you run them, do not moderate servers.

Dear Mojang,

I have loved Minecraft for a long time. Some of my best memories over the past few years have been spent on my or a friend's hosted server, having fun with my friends. We swear. I play Minecraft because it lets me connect with my friends in a way that we all enjoy. If I get my account permanently banned from online play for saying something that I would say in real life, to people I would say it to in real life, in an environment that is entirely private, how does this make sense? 

Additionally, I have many concerns with this even on public servers. No reporting system is perfect, and of course false bans would be plentiful. Even on servers like Hypixel, there is a constant issue of false bans. They can't manage their bans. How on earth would you be able to handle the bans of your entire consumer base? Anyone with a few alt accounts could get entire servers banned. This system was never necessary, and should never be implemented. Maybe an optional chat reporting option can be introduced, where it is up to the server moderators to deal with the reported chats, but that should be as far as this goes. If little Timmy joins my Minecraft server, just give him a warning saying that I swear and he needs his Mom's permission to play.

This has never been a problem.
They have to add fireflies back in, first.
The player can still build blocks around them so they don't get knocked off.
I totally agree! when the warden roars at you, it's all over, there's no hope of getting away. I think if you nerfed it, it would make it at least possible to get away.
the sonic boom should not be so deadly but it should be like a knock back stick but it stills deals damage but not as much.

I don't think it's necessary to make a separate enchantment table, you can just use echo shards instead of lapis. However, the cost of such enchantments should be really high, because in 5 minutes of clearing the ancient city of skulk blocks, you can already get level 10

Small Dripleafs should be farmable in some way in the first place. Currently the only renewable way of getting them is Wandering Traders. Even though they naturally generate in Lush Caves they will eventually run out, and it's problematic if you need a LOT of small dripleaf.
I personally think that the warden should be killable
Agreed actually. It would be a bit weird if the warden just suddenly burrowed after taking damage.
good

I would personally say if the warden gave you like a new effect called wardens pulse that kind of works like mini fatigue. I will give you darkness mining fatigue, and it would disable you from placing blocks as long as you are within a certain proximity of the warden. As for the shulk shriekers they should become deactivated after spawning a warden thus the warden doesn’t leave the area because you threw a snowball and another one spawn immediately. Maybe there can also be a way to reactive them as well for the people who want wardens for mini games and whatnot. The loot all I think needs to be changed if the random inchanted books should be max level so Smite V Protection IV meaning that no matter what the book is a good find for the player. If you were to add a custom music disc for the deep dark cities as well, and add some diamonds and diamond armor. Personally in my head J think of the loot as being the overworld equivalent of the Bastion loot.
Move end fortresses and end portals into ancient cities. Done.
in case there is anyone that is wondering what this says: have Minecraft world to be able to be stored on cloud storage

they should add seagrass and kelp to lake aquifers, the aquifers at the surface. Most often they are full of stone and sometimes dirt and stuff and no life. Fish should spawn in these surface aquifers like mini-lake or so.

Mojang if you're seeing this please add this feature. it gives more life to surface aquifers.

I think it is ok with level 0 light

also, with the new caves, it is essential
Theres no mod/data pack yet to revert back this hedious change. I opened a post on feedthebeast reddit so hopefully someone has a solution for it. Light Level 3 would be ok.
I think they should change it into shears instead because the player rarely walks around with shears on their main hand
Why shears? that doesn't make sense. and they should make copper oxidise faster anyways
there is one other way to unoxidized.
Makes me think why did they not think of this name before, it sounds just right!
I think deepslate sounds better than deepstone, deepstone sounds very generic in my opinion
It isn't really a slate. It is a type of stone that is comprised of multiple layers. Most people who play Minecraft don't even know what a slate is.
Cool idea, it would be nice to have a way to speed up striders (apart from using a speed potion).
Queria que na 1.20 poderiam adicionar fotos e câmeras
Its a good idea, but mineshafts and the little room in the deep dark look like they were crated by a player.
Well yes, that’s the point.

RUS:      Здравствуйте! У меня есть идея, как сделать так чтобы миры при переходе из старых версий к снапшоту 20w06a: генирировать новые пещере на высоте ниже 0 в изученных местностях,а в неизученных делать как будто создали новый мир. 

ENG:    Hello! I have an idea how to make the worlds in the transition from the old versions to the snapshot 20w06a: to generate new caves at an altitude below 0 in the studied areas, and in the unexplored ones to do as if they created a new world.

There's other aspects that the Spear could use improvements in. Outside of potential additional enchantments that could help with increasing the Ready State length, it would be nice if the shield was able to be used with the spear, allowing for blocking. When I was play-testing during the snapshot, I wasn't able to raise the shield when either jabbing or charging, where the swords, axes, and even the trident are able to do so. I would also like to add on that, besides reducing or eliminating the durability cost, Lunge should be able to be combined with Mending on the same spear in my eyes.

(Replying to above comment)

No? Since when could you attack and block with a shield at the same time?

I was playing around with the spear a realized you can't add mending to it if you already added lunge to it. Lunge makes moving around the world much faster but if you can't mend the spear it makes lunge no longer a valid means of transportation. Other than that it's amazing and will definitely be my new favorite weapon!!

The Lunge Enchantment's durability penalty seems a little.... too heavy. I would propose either a cooldown like with ender pearls, or possibly a lowered penalty, like maybe 24 at lunge III, and 16 at lunge II, though keeping the 8 at lunge I would be fine.
Lower the penalty from the "lunge" enchantment, the spear becomes very useful for mobility in terrain like mountains.

This would increase immersion and it would be cool if we could additionally customize it fully with json text components, also any worry of mistaking them for actual players is overblown because of how we've had similar features for ages in popular multiplayer servers (with plugins) and, if you're in a singleplayer world, well it's kinda obvious
